Description: Rim, body, and handle (reconstructed from numerous sherds) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed black below; handles black
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the shape and decoration find parallels with his Type 9 South Ionian cup with everted rim. the foot is slightly wider than most Type 9 cups. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. This type evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 20, pl. X, no. 5) (possibly)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.255)
